content:
Nice one ! 

I can not see the interest of the restriction on two consecutive bits set. 

Maybe you can add a clue to the solution since beginners can simply try to bruteforce the problem (and maybe 2^3000 is a little too big for bruteforce).
If Stilgart could mess it up while validating, that makes it a valid puzzle!

Thank you!

The two bits restriction is intended to enforce solution unicity, or there's no proper way to implement the puzzle in a given input/expected output the CG way. I hope I didn't mess it up.

I'm rather biased against more hinting about expected size than the test titles. I'll think it over. (But I kind of cruelly like the beginners complaining it's too hard on the forum :-> )
